div.head: Color of gold without gold on silver
div.ab: Color your applied silver leaf with terre emerita, and once dry, give a coat of spike lavender oil varnish and of sandarac. And it will be more beautiful than tinsel.

div.head: Layer of burnished gold on paper
div.ab: Make your ground of starch soaked in water & your gold will burnish very well. Clear starch water layered on the paper, then dried, & repeated in this manner 3 times, is a good layer for burnished gold on simple paper & has no body.

div.head: Removing stains
div.ab: Good eau-de-vie removes them if you rub the garment with it.

div.head: Ground for gold
div.ab: Ground terra emerita with some saffron, all of it mixed with very clear colle forte & passed through a linen cloth.

div.head: Extraction of oils
div.ab: Apothecaries say that anything which does not adhere to the mortar while being ground is oleaginous.

Take a well chosen tear of it which shows off its transparent red. And in a glass bottle put the best eau-de-vie you can find, in sufficient quantity. For it And stop it well and so quickly that it does not evanesce, otherwise it would be worth nothing. And leave it thus for a long time, because the longer it stays there, the more beautiful & better it will be & it will dissolve if it is good, otherwise it will become like lees. When you want to use it, make a small hole in the stopper of the bottle & pour a little & stop it again each time, then apply it on gold.
